title: Write a Taylor polynomial given derivative values

content.question: Let f be a function having derivatives of all orders for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>></mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyOpa4JaaGimaaaa@3BBA@</annotation> </semantics> </math> such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E2D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F25@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>″</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EF5@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>‴</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F01@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following is the third-degree Taylor polynomial for f about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maaaa@3BBB@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
